entry.title: R Weekly 2024-W34 Git Merge, Community, Quarto Templates
entry.summary:
Hello and welcome to this new issue! How to have (my) content shared by R Weekly? This weekâ€™s release was curated by Eric Nantz, with help from the R Weekly team members and contributors. Highlight Please let me merge before I start crying and other things Iâ€™ve said at the Git terminal A New R Community in Ahmedabad, India, focused on Clinical Research and Pharmaceutical Industries Designing and deploying internal Quarto templates Insights Reclaiming your weekend with data contracts Contributing to the R Project Creating a sustainable open-source ecosystem: Lessons from an NSF Grant and the #rstats hashtag From idea to code to image: Creative data visualizations in R
Context is King R in the Real World Please let me merge before I start crying and other things Iâ€™ve said at the Git terminaâ€¦

entry.title: How a Mass Stabbing Set the U.K. Ablaze
entry.summary: It truly is troubling just how many Brits, on both sides of the political divide, are willing to burn their cities down at the drop of a hat.

entry.title: Can Republicans Beat Kamala Harris and the Media?
entry.summary: The press makes itself vulnerable when it attempts to alter the course of events rather than simply report on them.

entry.title: Itâ€™s a â€˜Vibesâ€™ Election Now, and for Trump Thatâ€™s Bad
entry.summary: Kamala Harris has one key advantage: She is not Joe Biden and she is not Donald Trump.

entry.title: Maduroâ€™s Attempted Election Theft Threatens Venezuela, America, and the World
entry.summary: If the Venezuelan strongman remains in power, his regime will become an even larger national-security threat to the U.S. Urgent measures are needed.
